snippet: The lack of strong growth might result in lowered outlooks for the quarter.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that retail sales, excluding gas station sales, grew only modestly in May and fell in April; report could lead economists to lower their outlooks for economic growth in the April-June quarter; Labor Department reports the producer price index fell 1 percent in May.
lead_paragraph: The lack of strong growth might result in lowered outlooks for the quarter.

headline.main: Retail Sales Inch Higher as Gas Slips
headline.print_headline: Retail Sales Inch Higher As Gas Slips
